page.title: 09St Mary's and St Margaret's
page.content: The church is a conspicuous land mark in Stow Maries. It can be seen for many miles especially when the red cross which surmounts the white spire is lit up. About a dozen worshippers regularly attend Sunday service. Stow Maries is part of the much larger parish of Cold Norton and Purleigh. The Rev. Tillett is minister over the whole area. The Blessed Sacrament is kept in the church and the services are more akin to the orthodox church. There has been a church on the site since Norman times but the body of the present church is 500 years old although the altar is 650 years old. The bell is 300 years old and the pews are 100 years old. The first burial recorded was of Emma White in 1560 and the first marriage was between Henry & Hannah in 13.8.1837.
